Their service is outstanding. Our waiter cooked the meats for us and kept coming by to make sure it was cooking well. Ymmmmmm!! We'll be back for sure soon.

TvGzyFpVA2wsGdeh_4MG0A.text: Las Vegas has been a growing mecca for foodies all over. We stopped into Magal BBQ recently and are pleasantly surprised. This is not your typical KBBQ spot that is ayce. They serve special combos that specialize in special cuts of beef and pork. The selection is plentiful and the meat choices are very high quality. The ambiance is very modern and very clean. Young, our server took the time to share about the history of their restaurant and explained the menu thoroughly. This is possibly one of the best KBBQ restaurants i've been to ever!

ke31yc0ZmIGozRvceyzXTQ.text: This place I definitely my new favorite place for korean BBQ. My kids and I tried the need combo with pork belly and need rib soup as an add on. Our sever sunny was so awesome and provided such amazing service. I loved that we did not have to stress about cooking our own food and everything was so good! The only con I would say is no sake but my kids enjoyed everything. The meat was drinks tell high quality and I can't wait to come back!!

7V3iRiDPWvgat1GDM-ZQNA.text: This place smells SO GOOD the second you walk in! The meat is super fresh and tasty! Seriously delicious, great service, perfect set up. Our server, Troy gave us his recommendations and we were set for the whole meal - not disappointed at all! Great vibe, music is playing, but it wasn't too loud. The pork belly is a must, the brisket is my fave of all the BBQ places I've tried in town. I'm sold on the Heotkkae berry tea too - refreshing and detoxing. It tastes like water sweetened with the syrup in a boba jar! They're open until 3a so this would be the perfect 4th meal after a night out. They have lunch specials too...I will DEFINITELY be back! My son ate so much, I couldn't believe it! Try them, you will be a believer too!

aWAwoWoT1oARhb6fs0kbng.text: Oh my! A lot of Korean restaurants don't have that traditional  deep down taste of Korean food. Magal changed my mind. Their tteokboki was very flavorful. I normally need to add salt or soy sauce for my yeukkaejang. Not with Ma gal. All their food was delicious. Kimchi was made fresh ( You can even taste the oyster.) I was going to take pictures but I tasted one bite and couldn't stop. Found a great place. I don't like to go to China Town, however I'll overlook that for Magal

T6I-rqCJVAsAsxk3UMGW5A.text: All foods are very tasty even the side dishes are so good!!! Just look for Young for your server. He speaks both English and Korean perefectly and very kind!

kFlhnr2nXnpFJeDPqma17A.text: We came here for our first time. And hands down first impression was amazing. The interior was very decorative and modern with a twist unlike any of the Korean BBQs me and my boyfriend have been to. Young our serve was awesome . Super energetic, knowledgeable, and has a great spirit he brings to the table. Definitely made our experience. Thank you for the great time and food .

943rG1PVLgfXi7au1CHUeg.text: Finally got off the strip!  Let's check out Chinatown but where to eat?  Oh, let's just drive and I'm sure we'll find something!  Bammm...MaGal... Thank you for the glowing white Neon lights or else we wouldn't have stopped.    First thing you notice is that it's pretty darn clean for a BBQ joint and it was packed for a week day.  That's always a good sign.  Cutting it short. Everything from service to quality of meats, and banchan was TOP GRADE and  flavorful.  Most places don't even give you bean soup anymore or really stingy w/ the banchan.    The waiter made it clear that he was cooking the meat for us and all we had to do was enjoy and that we did!  And a shave ice dessert to end it all.  We will most definitely be coming back here on our next trip to Vegas!  Thanks TOMMY for an amazing meal and service!

di76zmJkdD5HuD5v0QsgQA.text: So far so good. Can't complain... "yet". kidding!   Ambiance: Well, it's something different. It's like a "fine" dining k-bbq that you kinda not see all the time by the area where it's established. 5stars for it.   Parking Lot: Its not a struggle! very spacious and great location actually.   Guest Service: Our server is just awesome (look for young! lol) Very accommodating with all of my questions (with all of the food that's "unfamiliar" with my tastebuds and my sights ). For that i'm giving 5 stars. Keep it up Young!   Food: All was superb. Served fresh and the meats are all that good of a size compare if we u to the common ones that of course we all love. What i just didn't liked was the salad with the seeds on it "but" it's good though it's just not a favorite and the pickled bokchoy and celery  (sorry) and last the cold soup... it just doesn't catch my tastebuds though. I was hoping for the skirt steak but unfortunately their out. *bummer*   Spoiler: If you love Korean Novelas and you want to try the Spicy Rice cake... Their spice rice cake is a must!    So for food, i gave them 4stars! More room for improvement.   Lastly, Price: Their combo's are actually pretty decent and reasonable but if you want a mix beef and meat, then you gonna pay per plate of beef and pork. So for that being said, 4stars as well.   Improvements: The Fire on the Pit. It's waaaaay too high. (please do fix it, i'm concerned on the hands of your servers. It's just scary! ) Also, it seems your extinguisher doesn't work much. Yup! so hopefully, its way better next time on our next visit. I gave it a 4stars for room for improv

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The coolest part of the store is this part! Hooraaaaay for this freebies.
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Sushi
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So far so good. Must try.

YOTg2zwJ17-rvOWGRPKiPw.text: Clean and fun place. So much food. We got the feeds  3-4, for our 4 person group and couldn't eat even 3/4 of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing food. Amazing service. We had 4 people and got the &#34;feeds 3-4&#34; meal and it was twice the food we needed! Soooo much but so good.

xfYg4YvjVHni-lJ3XlMALQ.text: Eat here.    I really don't need to say more than this but here are some details for you "reading"-type Yelpers.   Ended up going here THREE times during the latest Vegas trip.  Tried the beef combo, lunch specials and the volcano fried rice. Why?  - Food was good.  - Excellent portions with tons of side dishes.  - They'll replace the sides if you ask.  - Service was on point. From the greeting to cooking the meats and fried rice at the table.  - Prices were reasonable.   - Ample parking space. - TVs everywhere.  - Kid friendly. Yes, I was in Vegas w/ a 3 year old.  Just to be a bit objective and prepare those who are K-BBQ virgins, here are some distractions.  - This is not AYCE.  - There will be times when the music will be blasting fast, K-pop music.  - ALL servers will appear like they're serving ALL the tables communicating on their walkies and "streamlining" the service.  - Just because they're speeding around doesn't mean you have to.  Sit down and enjoy the food.   Last bit of advise: - Drink the tea (hot or cold) - Get the shaved ice dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No room for dessert?  LIES!!!  There&#39;s always room for dessert.

TI9QihjjyHsyli72GO3HeA.text: Wow oh wow.  Being from LA I did not expect such good korean bbq out here.  This place is not all you can eat.  NOT AYCE.  If you are here expecting ayce, go back to the strip and go to a buffet.  Quality does reign supreme here and quantity comes at a close second.    Immediately when you sit, you get the Korean soju house creamed corn, and an egg dish that cooks as you eat.  I did the gogi combo and I was a bit hesitant that this little tea sandwich contraption was going to fill me up but I am seriously about to give birth to an 8lb baby because I am so full.   If you make it to the end, get ready to have a server make the fried rice with egg dish.  Not too sure what it is? I'm not going to explain so you can order it and fall into the line of regretting of eating too much.    This place is good and the quality of the meat really shows.    5/5

uLpey_j9KgkseD7XAYE6pQ.text: solid 4 star place. But have to say the service is a plus if Yelp allow I would give 4.5 star rounded up to a 5 star because the manager reacted excellently to a server's negligence. Life happens so as mistakes. Instead of blaming the server, the manager who worked last night perform professional and polite. He is not just physically present in the restaurant but actively engage. Good manager not just supervise but also do everything he can to make up the mistake. As for the food, meat quality is good, marbled short rib melt in mouth. Eating with a little bit of sea salt and garlic makes the taste even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scramble egg with fried rice
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano fried rice

8il7p-yFVnkmxA1W0gKBgQ.text: yummy and delish! Everything you want from Korean BBQ. Meat tastes fresh and the banchans go well with the meat. Jennifer grilled our meats to perfection. She even grilled a small portiin of the meats to well done for our kids. She was so nice, thoughtful, and considerate.   I will definitwly come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good. No time yo take pictures lol.

Z14bGEdWgLIqPY55CxqAPA.text: I went there two or three times already. I understand that not that many or none of Korean chain restaurant(s) in Vegas before this one came. But well, I still feel this place is just a regular one. Taste and small plates: good Service: good Parking: good

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CXri5zs1ynTgbCruHyYdbA.text: Wow! My expectation was OK. I didn't expect that I can actually be a fan of korean BBQ place. As soon as they bring the appetizers, my eyes and my nose is immediately intrigued. Every single dish is so delicious. It's similar yet so different in a refreshing way.   This place is also the first place I known that give soup as part of the appetizers. All the appetizers are really well made even though it's free.   The house salad is perfect to have with the meal. No matter how delicious a grilled food, i always need some kind of vegetables to balance my diet. But their house salad is so good that I might even order that as a takeout for future lunch diet.   The way the grill setup is very unique. There is a well on the left half side for an omelette. And right half side is reserved for the cooked meat. The server grill all the food from start to the end. Two or three server take turn making sure my meat is not burn. I don't have to touch the grill tongs once!  I hope my fabulous dining experience here is not a fluke. I will be back to make sure that this restaurant stays as my favorite korean restaurant in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

npgvE5Wkq5gvK98BlJ0GAQ.text: Very good quality starters, and meat. The quantity of the food is huge. Overall the restaurant is one of the best Korean bbq I ever been to and the price is reasonable.

Cj-lLG1dqOjAWapsiwicPg.text: Got the Beef Course Meal for 4.  Breakdown of cost was about $25/person.  We felt it was plenty of food and found no need to order extra items from the menu as the accompanying side dishes (salads, soups, plain rice) were just right.   Beef groupings - Great quality of food Prim Beef Rib, Sliced Prime Brisket, Prime Boneless Short Rib, Marinated Short Rib, Skewers, Soybean Paste soup /w Cabbage, and Boneless Short Rib Sushi plate  Lucy was our server and although there was a bit of a language barrier for us, she did her best to explain the process. She was constantly at our side preparing the meal and ensured we always had what we needed.  Will go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table setting before ordering

fdTWUXOPraq3FEoA4ZzKjQ.text: Location: easy to find and lots of parking.   Price:  Reasonable price for a good quality food and great customer service!   Food:  It's to die for, meat were very tender and tasteful. We ordered beef bbq (small) and was enough for us.  Service:  Sunny (server) - lover her, she's very attentive and friendly. Knows what customer wants and refilled our side dish without basking her.   Ambience:  quite but probably because it's slow, very spacious, clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ouah5OrBBPzNd6c2mBEWPQ.text: So this was my first experience for Korean BBQ, and it was awesome! My boyfriend and I chose the small beef combo. I did not expect having THAT much banchan!!! The portions were generous too.  I loved that we had both cold soup & hot soup. OH! And the barley tea!!!! Such a big deal for me because I haven't had that since I was a little girl when my mom used to make it so it was like going down memory lane each sip   The only thing I would change is the pace of the servers cooking the food. I think it should be slowed down a few notches just so my belly can digest the food before the next round... but that minor detail was lack of communication on my part. Also, some of the meats could have more flavor to differentiate a little more from each other.   Other than that, the service here was great from the time we walked in the door, with warm greetings, our cups kept full, tending to our grill, and left with full tummies! (David is a great server! )  Overall, great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BANCHAN
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious with jalapenos!!!
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WpgwXpRUjTmKRj0D4jT3Zg.text: Amazing bbq. Such a good deal especially after a night of Vegas. Our waitress Sunny was really friendly and funny. She made our day.  The best thing here is the galbi and skirt steak.

uj7AHZAwmJDSxzwFpkJP0g.text: Delicious delicious delicious! By far the best Korean BBQ experience I've had. Had dinner here last night with my boyfriend and his friend, who introduced us to this restaurant. The service was impeccable as all servers were completely on it. When I say on it, I mean on it. There was no time where I felt like we were running out of anything or we had extra plates or trash that needed to be removed from our table because the servers were always there seamlessly to take care of everything and anything.   In regards to the food, the servers cook the food for you in your personal grill. They cooked the food to perfection. The food here is not served to you buffet style, therefore the quality of the food is excellent. You do not feel heavy when you walk out. We had rib eye steak, a thinner steak and the short ribs and they were amazing! As part of the condiments, the servers brought out kimchee, rice, egg with kimchee, this corn pasta thing and salads. This place is a must try!

aoNwcgx3xxn9O9_HjsuymQ.text: Best Korean BBQ I've had since living in Seoul. Sunny was incredibly helpful during our meal and left us wanting to come back again ASAP.   10/10 would smash again

tHPT972s0_Ez4MiBwCMkeA.text: Magal BBQ was pretty good, I typically like doing all you can eat at tofu hut because this didn't really fill me up at all. It also didn't come with rice which was weird.The meats was good but it wasn't anything special from other kbbq places I've had. The side dishes weren't good and I didn't like the melting cheese that they had either. I really liked the hangover tea that they served though. And I liked how they had hot corn and egg which other places don't have!

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef sushi :)

llFFqXSeowGp6BoV-hM_Eg.text: The waiters and waitresses here were very courteous and helpful.  I've had kbbq at other places countless times, but this place takes the cake!  Had the beef meat combo -- the quality was amazing!  From the marbling to the marinades, this place hands down is top notch when it comes to taking care of the customer and prepping and presenting the food.  Premium ingredients, good alcohol, and good times

50sXHnxZfeZ7mxp5qUCWKA.text: We were in Las Vegas for a week and decided to checkout Chinatown. Based on the great reviews, we chose this place. We walked in and decided to get the Magal Combo for somewhere around $94.99. I forgot the actual price. Might have been $99.99.  Any way, we were given so much food. Like a lot of KBBQ places, they give you all the banchan(side dishes) you want. The thing about this place is that the waitress helps you BBQ the food. I'm not sure if it is customary for all KBBQs in the states to cook the food for you but I'm used to just being given the meat myself and having to cook it myself.  It came with short ribs, pork belly, ribeye and squid. Pretty amazing price for that much food. Everything was juicy but I think I'd be fine without the squid.

DSTGHCctUyD3bEKMdF-xoA.text: If you have a baby who needs to sit in a high chair, AVOID THIS PLACE!  After we have ordered our food and when the meat arrived, the waitress told us not to touch the meat being cooked since she has to do it. But because the high chair has to be located in the walkway, we had to keep moving our baby away to make room for her.   To avoid this continuous back and forth movement of the high chair, I placed my son on my lap. Then, the next thing happened: hot boiling soup bowl placed right in front of my son and I. And the guy just walks away as if it is alright to place something boiling in reach of a baby. Of course we quickly moved the bowl as far as we can from my son.   Next up was the blow torch to sear the meat. The plate that was used to sear the meat was placed in front of my son and I. The waitress blasts away with the flame toward my son and I. I told her immediately to stop and to do it some place else because the torch show wasn't worth getting a severe burn on either of us.   Finally, the metal oil container that was located inside the ventilator caused the last issue. The container was located right above myself and it suddenly dropped to our plates. Luckily nothing was inside the container and no one got hurt. But if that metal container was full of whatever it was supposed to contain, some of us could have been seriously injured.   I asked for the manager on site to address these issues and the guy who placed the hot bowl in front of us comes and says he is the manager. The guy told us 20% discount has been applied for the "inconvenience" that happened during our visit, as if money takes care of everything.   Thank you for ruining my mother's birthday luncheon.  Never going back again.

cO8fRDTZhwe4mbfK58mevg.text: If you are looking for amazing Korean BBQ in Las Vegas, come here. You won't regret it.  While taking an Uber around Vegas, we sparked up a conversation with our South Korean driver. One thing led to another, and we asked him for his recommendation for the best KBBQ joint in Vegas. He said MAGAL.  He expressed how hard it is to find authentic BBQ in America, but how this place does it really well (and at a super reasonable price). We were sold.  We walked in to a clean environment with friendly staff. We chose the MAGAL combo and the food appeared almost instantly. Seriously freaky fast.  At this particular KBBQ restaurant, they cook the food for you. All you have to do is sit back, relax, and enjoy the delicious food. After the first few dishes, we knew we would be coming back ASAP.  And the portions are perfect. We ordered a combo for two and were fighting to finish every delicious KBBQ bite. I'd be very surprised if you left this place hungry.  This place's food is amazing, the staff are friendly, environment is clean & modern, &... I am struggling to find anything negative about this place.   I just hope this chain grows & grows so one will pop up closer to my hometown soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pGP2VcI14ahxjNrFnISZog.text: The Magal BBQ combo is plentiful. As in, it says 2 people's worth and those are two very hungry people. I ended up having leftovers for another dinner after getting it with one other person. I'd say the meat is better than the AYCE places, though overall I would say Hobak is slightly better. The meats did get progressively better, and none of them were bad. The little egg side slot unfortunately basically stumped us until the eggs were already a bit overcooked. I prefer a regular side of steamed egg over that. The sides were not quite as good as Hobak, but enjoyable enough. Service was good.

M1c-a5qZj90FlSTXrAitnA.text: Super quality, great portion size and complementary Pat Bingsu. Came here with my family and the menu for two was enough for two adults and two kids. Will come again next time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yfkj-YY6SvZTkWsRrX8_lQ.text: First time at Magal. It's Friday night and it was kind of empty - not a good sign, folks. Had the magal combo and everything was pretty bland and mediocre, unfortunately. Server cooked the meat on very low heat, so it didn't develop a nice char.  Didn't care for the beef sushi, torched table-side. Gimmicky and pointless, since you have a perfectly good grill right there. The sides were just meh, and so was the service. Half way through the meal I was kicking myself for not going to Hobak instead.

FmacBoMjQyQs_APn7pga6Q.text: Another awful experience with the same waitress every time we dine here. We had dinner around 9pm on a Saturday and waitress had a bad night again or just her bad attitude. We can totally see it in her face when the young  boy brought out the ban chan missed some of the side dishes, which I think as a customer is totally understandable but this waitress wasn't too happy about it and give him attitude, bad vibes here.   Towards the end of the dinner which was around 10pm, we asked about happy hour on alcohols and she  either was lying about no happy hour on weekends or False advertisement on ads (see photo). Anyhow, we like the food not the waitress. If she serve us next time again, I will turn around and walk out the door to another Korean restaurant with better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8sCQBnMvjtHptJIyabPfAA.text: Very good food! That's the best Korean food I had for the past twenty years! Amazing! And service was very good! The waitress was so nice and professional!

DED7ZR4i2P-6djhEP5Mq9A.text: Their seafood pancake is the best I've had at a restaurant hands down. Other than that, all their meat is very well prepared, and the staff get the meat cooked just right.

eEqrvrazqWVmFZSRJXKMZg.text: An actually 5 Star kbbq place, would you imagine that!  Took babe here for the beef plate. It's definitely enough for two people. You get rice and a bunch of sides, including egg, seaweed salad, regular salad, kimchi, and much much more!  The meats were the star of the show! So flavorful, no need to add anything to them. They were tender and tasty. The employees actually help you cook your food.   Babe really enjoyed the beef sushi. This place is very good! On the pricier side but definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n0Phw1HtL3pDndbmSZDg9Q.text: Higher-KBBQ at a higher price.  Honestly, I feel like my experience could have been a lot better here. Unfortunately, the restaurant was on the busier end (5pm) so our server ended up burning a lot of our meat/ over cooking it because he forgot to check on it. Which is fine when we're meant to grill our own food- but our server told us we should trust him to cook it. We did-- I regretted it.  I'm Korean so I've eaten all kind of KBBQ. At the price we were paying-- I was definitely expecting more. Portion sizes were on the smaller end, which is fine. I understand we're not at AYCE. But 3 slabs of over cooked pork belly for $26? Not too stoked about that.   In terms of the quality of the meat though-- it was pretty good! I've been spoiled since I just got back from Seoul and LA. Compared to those places, LV Magal was still acceptable. Again- just wish the server cooked the meat better!  Haha-- actually, there is a Magal in LA and my experience there was bomb. They really have a handle on the grilling and the meat quality is better Better service, better quality food. So interesting how two restaurants of the same chain can be pretty different.  In LA- Quarters is also really good! And if you're looking for a premium all you can eat experience check out Mr. BBQ in Fullerton. Those are my favorites.  Back to the meats here though-- my favorite meats here were definitely the beef short rib (not marinated) and the beef skirt meat.   Maybe Magal LV was just having an off day. Good luck.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs~
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly for $26... small portion...

WSt3c5oOY21gzvgy6qDRdg.text: I'm here anytime we come to visit Las Vegas, Lunch server is very nice and friendly. The soup called yookkajang is very delicious. You should all visit this restaurant.

tXPZeUwDs7bDU088vOK6wg.text: Not sure how this place has such high ratings, but I'm guessing it the beef BBQ?.. which I didn't try. Came here for an early dinner because I really wanted Korean chicken BBQ. When we arrived the hostess said they did not have chicken, but we decided to stay anyway since we were already there. While flipping through the menu I ended up finding the chicken on the menu... hmmmm... ordered that and soondubu (tofu soup). The soondubu was NOT soondubu.. it was basically just soup with tofu in it :( My boyfie and I were super disappointed. DO NOT order this thinking it's traditional tofu soup!!!   As for the chicken, it was really good, but it just took an eternity to cook. We didn't start eating it until maybe OVER 30 mins after it was on the grill. Not the restaurants fault. The side dishes were lacking and there wasn't much variety. They were also MEH.   Not a very authentic spot for Korean food. I'll stick with Si Jang down the street.

DttNpg1ko1Cmm_K6WE-uFA.text: My favorite KBBQ spot. It isn't AYCE so we just get their A combo. The flamed sushi rice is amazing. The cuts are always amazing.  I've always had amazing service.

FtN1aXFBgrZZbZaeCYv-bA.text: Decent Korean BBQ   But my favorite is Gen still.   They need to improve the quality of the meet dishes here. And prices are higher.

eJ1EN5u6MHMXwnpwK0pfqw.text: Came here with some friends, and they had some interesting kimchi that was a little different than other places.  The meats were well marinated and tasty.  I wasn't that hungry since I ate breakfast an hour before I came here, so I only ate a few pieces of meet.  But I'll be back to try this place and then update my review.  The service was a little slow with the water and kimchi refills, they seemed to be really busy but there were only 3 other tables during lunch.  They looked like they were hard at work though and not just hanging around talking.  So I'm not dinging then for service.

_8tAxy-GHXObM_lcMxJZ8Q.text: I organized a Vegas weekend trip for 20+ people and wanted to find a good spot for a group dinner. I quickly found that restaurants on the Strip that take reservations are expensive and want to hold our credit card. Thinking outside of the box, I suggested Magal BBQ to the group and it was a huge hit.  We were set up in the back group room, which accommodates up to 24 in six tables of 4. One experienced server was dedicated to our room and she did a fantastic job accommodating all of our needs. We decided to simplify our payment by having each table of 4 order and pay amongst themselves. My table of 4 ordered the large Magal combo which came with many types of beef, pork, veggies, and even squid at the end. We also got a couple of bottles of soju to share. Three big guys and I had plenty of food to go around.   Our server was super pleasant and was very aware of the dietary (no beef) restriction of one of the diners at an adjacent table. She cooked the one cut of beef in their order first, then switched grill-tops and tongs thereafter to ensure that nothing else touched beef. It was very thoughtful of her.  She also offered us dessert (yummy shaved ice) if a few of us checked-in on Yelp, which we didn't hesitate to do. Since our group had quite a few December birthdays to celebrate as well, we also brought our own cake. Unlike some other places, Magal was happy to let us bring our own and helped make sure everyone had plates and utensils to enjoy the cake.   My table of 4 rounded up our tip and the total of this great meal was $40 per person.

vwoBDdid6DNyqJk78pFubQ.text: They have excellent services and the food is very fresh and yummy. They open till 1am and their last call is 12am. The server will converse with you to make sure everything is ok. I had been to the korean place across the street, this place is way better. I will definitely come back next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good services and yummy food

-9o8-dl7BhSqzZmyZ0hf0A.text: Real Traditional Korean food I ever had. This restaurant have 5 stars for both the food and service. How lucky I am to have a BBQ here.  We enjoy many free appetizers. I don't take photos because my friends and I eat all of them in 10 minutes. The waiters are attentive and cooked the meat for us. I can only do my job "Meat eater" with their perfect service. Nice experience here.

pOqMJAcq8D1cBSeU3wQUaw.text: Decent and very nice staffed Korean BBQ place where they cook and cut the meat for you. The sides were pretty standard Korean side dishes except the mash potatoes was a surprising pumpkin mash. Very nice.   We got the beef package for 4 people because there was 4 of us and we couldn't finish it lol. But it was pretty good. However, their smoke ventilation doesn't do that great of a job. At other kbbq places I've been to, they have adjustable ones that go right up the meat so you're not bothered by the smoke. It was pretty bad. My poor cousin was directly in the smoke's path like standing behind the grill when   someone is bbqing on the beach. The package includes pineapple and mushrooms which was very exciting. I could eat grilled pineapple all day.  The disappointing part was the scrambled egg and corn. Other places I've been to had corn cheese but this place was just regular corn. Scrambled eggs was whatever.   Despite their busy-ness, the wait was only like 20 minutes on a Saturday at 7pm.   Overall, a pretty standard staff cooks your meat place, but I wouldn't really recommend unless you wanna die from smoke inhalation.  FREE SHAVED ICE WITH YELP CHECK IN AYYYYY. It was very fluffy with some red bean sauce and peanut powder.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grill

smRe0Wl6Pb1BuPttaNuAOA.text: They know how to do Korean BBQ. They cooked everything for us. There was an awesome variety of meats and their vegetable side dishes were so good. Will definitely come back.

QdnA05lJtD3MorDOpMyTvA.text: We came in for lunch at opening to find they weren't ready to open but they let us in anyway.  They seemed a bit preoccupied because they weren't ready which was okay with us as we were talking and catching up.  One of the things that turned me off about it was that they tried to get us started but kept walking away and we ended up with burnt and raw egg bubbling onto the table.  We ordered the beef combo for 2 and it actually turned out to be a lot of food for 2 people.  I truly believe that 4 of us could have had it and been perfectly content.  I didn't realize that the last meat we would get was squid though and I thought that was kind of weird.  I mean I like squid but I ordered the beef combo.  Also, the "sushi" they serve was just not good.  Flavorless and covered in what tasted like watered down A1.  Not good.  The quality of the meats and marinades are what keeps this rating at a 3 and not a 2.  There were only 2 instances in which we got gristle and fat so for the price we were paying, it was well worth it.  The banchan were ok.  They weren't the best salads I've ever had and were a little lackluster but they were plentiful and not bad tasting.  I will gripe about them cooking the meats for us.  I usually like to go to AYCE because I don't want to be forced to eat something in a particular order but I understand this version and coming here I knew what I was getting myself into.  The problem I had was they were understaffed and didn't come around often enough. And when we would try to do it ourselves, someone would come by and kind of rudely take over.  I've been to other places and know that it can be done well so this was slightly irritating.

wN1AgTEfQZAQmhmmFouJ7A.text: I have to say the Kalbi soup was delicious but what made this experience so bad to the point of no return is the service. I waited in thefront for someone to sit me and servers and bussers were just looking at me and passing by and nothing then finally a server sat me with no menu. The busser actually saw me and noticed I had no menu. Then when I ordered everything went down hill from there. The servers only care if you come in a big group and will ignore anyone else. I was hungry and just got out of work to enjoy some soup. When the food came out the runner put it on an empty table and the server once she did about 5 rounds she finally came and dropped off my food and that was the last time she came to me. I raised my had hoping she noticed me so I can get a salt shaker and she saw me twice but never came. Then a busser came and asked if I needed something and I told him salt and pepper. Took a minute but he got it for me.     The worst experience of customer service that I have encountered. You see the other 3 servers checking everyone , refilling drinks, and asking questions but if you are not in a group they wont attend to you. I asked for my bill and the waitress in my section never came and finally another waitress gave me my check because I asked her. This place needs to understand that customer service is important and they need to train all their servers better on that

WixjWA10UBpgryQXrMSnrw.text: I won't be surprised that the number of K-BBQ joints (and Ramen shops) in LV surpasses SJ or SF.  When I searched on Yelp, so many popped up.  Evidently Magal is an international joint from Korea and has many branches in Singapore, Hong Kong, China, NY and LA.  Also, they are the first to use the egg well incorporated into their grill.  Supposedly, one will be opened up in SJ too but not sure when.  The difference between Magal and other K-BBQ is that the server will cook for you instead of DIY.  The problem is our waitress was serving four tables at the same time and busy going back and forth cooking for everyone.  Couple times our meat was on the verge of burning so I tried to move the meat aside but the waitress didn't like us doing that.  Perhaps she might get scolded by the restaurant for letting the customers work.  Not sure.  The combo probably is the way to go, although they are not cheap.  When the waitress brought out the tray, quantity seem to be on the small size, but it is more than enough for two.  Best to order the combo first then add on later if not enough.  Good quality meat for what you pay for.  Overall it's a pleasant experience.  Can't wait to have one in the Bay Area too.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef sushi wasn&#39;t torched enough so it&#39;s still too raw and tough to chew.  I ended up putting the beef on the grill to cook a little more.
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This beef sushi came with the combo.  The waitress will torch table side.

6saCxN2b4ZcuwKbyiw2zVw.text: We were not impressed overall.  The restaurant has a nice set up, we were greeted by the manager/owner when we walked in. Seated in a nice both and ordered our set meal.   We ordered the beef combo. Meat was very tender but the taste was so so. They all kind of tasted the same. The side dishes were alright.   The service was so rushed that I think my husband had indigestion. We wanted to cook our meat a little longer but the waitress kept coming back and removing it from the grill and said it's good. So we finally said something and she mumbled in Korean.   We were going to order dessert but they had none even if it was in the menu. We wanted the bingsu, but they said not available.   I'd rather go back to Hobak, service there was much better and friendlier. Not to mention the meat!

KRU0-mp5_vEcRpqOWaglCg.text: Great korean bbq; the sauce that they gave for dipping is delicious, and the combo is such a great value!

5tAvAunIbTeJ207Hn8GcpA.text: First time we came here my girlfriend and I were looking for a KBBQ spot that didn't have a long wait time. Ended up checking this place out and OH MAN was this a great decision!   When it comes to Korean BBQ I typically check for 3 things:   -how good is their brisket -do they have good brisket sauce aka ponzu sauce  -is it all you can eat   Magal has 2 of the 3. Unfortunately you won't find an all you can eat service here. Typically if you don't, you usually find that the meat quality is a lot better. So don't let that stop you from coming here.   My girlfriend and I ended up getting the Small Beef Combo, which comes with an assortment of meats. I was a bit hesitant getting this because I felt like these combo plates don't fill me up. Man, was I wrong! The Beef Combo had just enough meat that it made my girlfriend and I pretty full. The meat quality was amazing! Every time I took a bite out of the meat after dipping in on their amazing house ponzu sauce was incredible! I only wished there was more brisket on the plate just because I can eat Korean brisket all day! Perhaps it would be great if we can sub out one of the meats out for more brisket?   The environment there is great! It's nice and clean with plenty of room for you and your friends. They also have a party room in the back where you can have huge parties to enjoy some great quality food.   The service there is amazing! Friendly staff who takes their time cooking for you and even sparking up a conversation or two. One of the serves Young is one of their best! I was surprised when he still remembered my girlfriend and I when we stopped by the second time. He made us feel welcome and very helpful when we needed assistance or any questions we may have. Even though I feel we don't need to, the servers there will stop by and cook your food for you. You can choose if you want to or not but I feel like with them cooking, they'll always 1) make sure your food is cooked properly and 2) always checking in to make sure you guys are alright. Imo, ask for Young when you come by. Man deserves a raise!   Overall, I had an amazing experience here! I said I would definitely come back and I already did. And I will be visiting again. This place easily became my favorite Kbbq spot here in Vegas!

PjRz2V-NQIW6DdyZjwGlZw.text: I enjoyed the food the first time so I decided to bring my out of town family here for my birthday dinner. The food is very good! Place is clean and the servers are sooooo friendly. I would recommend this BBQ over others in Las Vegas.

D75y5IZubYBLOsiYSKX0iA.text: I haven't been to many Korean BBQ places in the US, so I don't have a backlog of American style KBBQ to fall back on, but I've been to quite a few BBQ places in South Korea and with that in mind, this place was GOOD.  That said, this is not a US style place.  If you're expecting an American experience, don't look here.  There will be raw egg cooking at your table and the server will be handling your food and cooking it.  Neither of these things are unusual in Korea, where the server often cooks for you, and raw food shows up in lots of different forms to be cooked at your table.  You'll probably also have to ask for things (more to drink, more sauce, etc.), it won't necessarily be replenished without asking.  There's even a button on your table to get prompt service, which is just like all the restaurants I've been to in SK.  Don't hesitate to push it (it's not rude) and ask for what you need instead of waiting for someone to notice, because you might be forgotten.  The samgyupsal (pork belly) is incredible.  We also got the beef combo and everything in it was *outstanding*.  I looove doenjang chigae (fermented soybean paste soup) and it was amazing.  The banchan was all to die for except that the kimchi was a bit young for my taste (I like it old and ripe!), but that would be my only complaint.  They even had the green onion salad with gochujang that I haven't had since I was in Korea.  The Cass beer and soju were both delicious as well.  Overall, if you're looking for a very authentic experience without a lot of concern for American sensibilities (we were the only white people there), check this place out.  If you're going to be weirded out by hot tea in plastic cups and raw egg cooking at your table, this place isn't for you!  But do go and try it out.  My god, it was incredible.  I haven't had Korean food this authentic since actually being in Korea.  It was just so, so good.  I can't say enough good things about it.

fU7KOzueAcZ4Ztj5a87IRg.text: Let me start off by saying I love Korean BBQ. This place IS NOT ayce but that's okay. Usually at ayce spots, the cuts of meats are not great, it's more about quantity over quality. Let me start by saying the quality of meat at this place is excellent. A large beef course was able to feed my whole table and we were 5 adults. You walk out here feeling satisfied but not overly bloated like I usually do after having ayce. Great atmosphere and great service. I love the egg and cheese corn that heats up next to the grill. Also, it's nice not having to cook your own food, I rather just eat. Food is delicious. Will definitely come back.

Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Br5GobDxcHRxzIvN1xGoAQ.text: "So pork skin in special sauce and marinated pork entrails.  What else?"  I begin while reading the online menu.  "What's a hagfish?  Heck, we gotta get one of those, and how do they make a chicken foot boneless?   We have to try it"  continues my Asian poker bud.  "Oh come on guys" whines Midwest poker bud.  Magal, the newest, authentic KBBQ chain to enter the Vegas food scene by way of Korea through China, and Southeast Asia.  Authentic flavors, yes.  Expansive menu with more than just KBBQ, yes.  Distracting environment.   Loud K-Pop music videos showing on the monitors, servers dressed in tropical uniforms and straw hats, and an over the top branded decor reminiscent of Josie and the Pussycats.  The food however, is solid.  Tip:  ala carte beef and pork plates are large (one per person if planning to share).  Combo's offer the greatest variety at the best value.  All include veg for grilling and soup.  About the beef, like most KBBQ joints, PRIME equals good quality and NOT USDA Prime grade.  That said, the "PRIME" beef is plenty tender with good marbling.  Typical sweetened soy marinade.  Tasty.  Skirt, and shortrib cuts top the list.  The weak point, the thin sliced brisket end point.  Shaved from frozen into rolls and cooked as a roll, there's just not enough in the bite to release flavor.  Pork is their forte.  Belly, neck, sweet soy marinated pork collar and spicy marinated "skirt" (have no clue what this cut is) all have lots of internal fat that cooks up sweet and crisp.  Pork skin and entrails are on the menu as well.  We passed.  Gas cook tops.  Grills are changed as needed.  Hoods are good but not great so expect  eu de KBBQ when you leave.  Service is good.  They will offer to cook for you.  Unless you want all your proteins cooked well done, insist on cooking for yourself.  If they refuse to relinquish cooking, just reach in and pull your meats from the grill when you want.  Watch out LA, Vegas is stepping up its game.

BWi5EGU3iOp3ssnPn8LdDA.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! This place is phenomenal!!! My new favorite Korean Bbq place! Maybe I've been here more than 10 times since they grand opening...Lol The waiter Andy is such a great& personable guy..  All the staff (include young manager) are awesome!!! Ordered the large beef combo every time we were there which is such a great deal for 3 or4 of us... The bbq is so delicious as well.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND! We would definitely return soon :)

They are also unique in that they have a kimchi omelet that cooks around the grill. This is the same quality as the restaurants in Korea. I highly recommend it.

The boneless short ribs is my fav ! We also really loved the cold refreshing tea it has a Unique taste to it. Thanks to Troy we had the best service :)

d__kI1ZpIARab3yEM3uJYw.text: It's a decent Korean BBQ. My wife and I ordered the beef combo. All the different cuts of beef were tender but lack the nice rich beef flavor. Bachan were okay nothing really fantastic. Food were just oaky for me but the service was excellent. The servers did all the cooking and they worked well together as a team. And I like the ambience, it was clean and contemporary.  Pretty sure I will not go back, not because the food was horrible but because there's nothing compelling for me to go back. The other high-end Korean BBQ competitors just have better food.

vo-_bszCeb_bNyYxAUl4xw.text: Very good portions and Korean food !!! If you haven't tried this place I highly recommend it !!!

DRpc37-uDubn7G3FZS74Dg.text: With the glut of new Korean restaurants, everyone seems to be putting on their best efforts. Ma gal is short for small town sea gull in Korean so they include pineapple and shrimp to all BBQ courses. We ordered the beef course which included our waiter to use a torch to flambe meat sushi. The meat quality is on par with their  competition down the street. Our waiter, named Young, was cute and funny. Request for him if you go. I had him drink with us since he was so affable, attentive and entertaining. Just make sure to tell the hostesses that you are not doing BBQ if you just want to order off the menu instead of opting for the BBQ courses (which are a way better deal).  Overall this is a one of the few places in Vegas that offer korean food similar in quality to the Korean restaurants in LA.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wang Galbi tang

Bb5u3LlDO_hPP-lRZ0dT1A.text: Really nice place! The food was tasty and the staff were very friendly.   We ordered the Magal combo small size. It was enough to feed 3 people. It came with white rice and one clay pot of Korean miso soup (also very good!). The meat was so tender. My favorite were the marinated ones. The lady at the restaurant grilled for us, so all I needed to do was stuffing myself with all the food.   Large portions of side dishes, from what I can remember we got kimchi, vegetable salad, pickles, and macaroni salad. At the end of the meal we got a huge bowl of red bean shaved ice. Perfect for the summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Magal combo. Every single meat dish they served was great!

cfwqXB6wNpvQyrfFgE69Rg.text: Came in for dinner last night with husband and daughter, and first impression was clean, hip restaurant, not too smoky for a KBBQ. Greeted by friendly staffand seated in a booth right away.  Pros:   great value! We ordered the Magal combo for 2, and were barely able to finish it with 3 people.  Special kudos for the kalbi and for the spicy squid.  Total bill came to $64 before tip (we didnt have any alcohol), which for 3 people was awesome.  Lots of different sides, including 3 different types of salads, and various banchan inclthe usual kimchi, and several more.  Extremely attentive staff! Great service!  Cons:    Most meats weren't marinated. We would have enjoyed a more typical kbbq experience with bulgogi, spicy pork and such.  Banchan didn't include some of my faves like fish cake and kimchi was not spicy or fermented.  Severs wouldnt let us grill ourselves, even though we asked them to.  They said sure, then kept coming back to fuss with the foodon the grill.  For us, part of the kbbq experience is doing the grilling ourselves.  Overall: positive experience, but next time we'll look for a place that does more types of marinated meats on a combo menu.

iNYaEO4IPMoNNIbDmfIknw.text: Best Korean BBQ experience. The waitress knew exactly what to do every time she came to our desk, and we just enjoyed the grill.  The timing of when to finish grilling the meat always confuses me, but at here, they did all the grill for us. Many KBBQ places say that they do the grill for the customers, but unfortunately I've not seen one except this place. Recommended if you are like us who don't know when the beef/pork would be ready on the grill lol! Also, ordering was simple, there is no menu with 10 pages, but just a couple combo options and single items in case you need more. We two ordered the skirt meat combo and we are completely satisfied with the variety of the dishes in the combo.

XKaB4_YfJo-blqMBzAkcbA.text: Skirt steak, short rib, squid, BANCHAN= ALL DELICIOUS! Meat was so tender. Service was quick and they were very timely with getting the meat of the grill at the right time. Always a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat combo

FOu7pCriKK7bPFH1vOG4qw.text: Service was good. Waiter was grilling the meat for us. We had our own water bottle/tea for self pour/serve. We ordered Magal Combo for two. Rib eye slices, pork belly, steak, sushi steak rolls(4peice), beef rib. Portion size not enough for the price of $64.00 after tax. Wish there was more beef rib and meat period. Beef rib was only pretty much one piece and they sliced the meat off to make 3 piece. The marination of the meat was very bland. Could be better. Side dishes were very good. The Kimchi was spicy which I loved! Love the grill how the had the egg and corn cooking on the side of grill. Makes it a little unique. One thing I would say is this place is not all u can eat meat like the others I been to before so just don't come on empty stomach.

aFO-vtNEmuWwha7ExCjASg.text: TGIF!!!Last Friday 12/7 with my co-workers. First time here ! One of coworkers recommend to come here and so we did!   This K-BBQ is located in Chinatown. When I was looking for the place it was hard to see the signage but as soon as I saw my co-workers I was in the right place.  As soon we stepped in  we were directed in the private dining area. Cute little set up where we had TVs and ladies you were able to put your bags and jackets inside your seat which are little barrels. How convenient and creative! Just don't forget your belongings!  Our Coworker just ordered for us and everything was amazing! BTW we did not have to cook our meats. Our waiter did that for us which was very convenient  and did not have to worry about our bbq being burned. Service was on point and accommodating.   To be honest with I had too many Sojus and Korean beer to drink. As long you are with Great Company and great Korean BBQ its always a great time.

8cUqvHveSk6AHXRpnOT2XA.text: We had a lovely experience here at Magal! The restaurant is separated by comfortable booths that each have their own private grill. The service is phenomenal. They are super attentive and even cooked our meat for us.   We ordered the Magal combo which was waaaaay more than enough for four people. The meat quality was delicious. I especially loved the short rib and sliced brisket. The grilled pineapple was a yummy way to end the meal too. With the combo, they even gave us a shaved ice for dessert.   Would highly recommend!

tZIGF39n_qdDHJtmz1W6Bw.text: Amazing Korean BBQ! Ate here for the first time and I was impressed! Magal BBQ is located in Chinatown, Las Vegas which is off the strip, but worth the short drive. The ambiance is modern, casual and clean. Service was awesome!   I went with my parents so the 3 of us ordered the largest meat combination for $104. We couldn't believe how many different meats and other sides came with this combo. I would suggest getting the smaller meat combo if it's just 2-3 people in your party because we couldn't breathe after eating almost everything. Some of the sides included bean sprout salad, toss salad, pickled daikon (radish), shiitake mushrooms, onion salad and potato salad. The combo came with 4 types of beef, seared beef nigiri, spicy ika (squid), mushrooms, tofu chige, corn salad with melted cheese, egg scramble, pineapple and shave ice for dessert. So worth it right?! My parents frequent Las Vegas like it's their second home so they will be back! Heck, I will be too! Thanks Magal BBQ!

SbUn9tXmhuOhpA3LIjRZMQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this Korean bbq spot! Their variety of packages are soo good. A little pricey but totally worth the cost. The customer service is great everyone is always smiling and very helpful. Its located in china town and among the other restaurants with the high level of foot traffic I expect it to be grungy but this place is very clean. They are constantly cleaning, even while they're cooking your meats.

SoSBcfP7ufUT88JroTqFKQ.text: It was so good that we came here twice on our visit to Vegas. The first time here was AMAZING. We had the best server. The meat is grilled for you and the servers are so attentive. The food is so fresh and the flavors are perfect. I've never had such good meat. The steak combo is a must. This place isn't an all you can eat but it's worth it. I recommend getting the kimchee fried rice. They cook it in front of you and the flavors are just perfect. Ooooo... the set also comes with wagyu beef sushi and its amazing. This has become one of my favorite KBBQ places. I recommend.

7Eq9vrZ5GtOjmliEw5pWAQ.text: The hours say they are open til midnight. We came in at 1030pm. They said its 10 minutes until last call. We were fine with that. We could order what we needed, cook it, eat and go, but that's not what happened. The guy who told us it's 10 minutes til last call then walked to the back of the kitchen and never came back. Hella rude! All the other employees just stared at us. If it's 1030pm and you're not seating people anymore, change your hours to say you close at 11 and not at midnight. My family and I walked out. Never coming back here again!

odrluyEL9V2E1V-iOQJXRw.text: My family... we're korean bbq people. We've been to most kbbq spots in LV and I am a huge fan of Kang Ho Dong in Ktown LA.  I was skeptical when we pulled into Magal. It was around 6:15 - the parking lot was empty and I was thinking, "oh geez - is this going to be one of those overrated/overhyped places?" and boy was I wrong.  First of all, the meat combos here are awesome. We did a two person combo for the 3 of us and it was more than enough. We had brisket, spicy squid, short ribs, pork jowl, and marinated short ribs. I loved the rim of cheese corn and the kimchi egg. My parents were big fans too. Definitely reminded me of KHD in LA.  The combo was extremely reasonably priced and competitive with other non-AYCE places in LV. The service was also great and I give them extra kudos for being extremely efficient.  Overall, I think this is a great non-AYCE KBBQ place in LV. My parents who are born & raised in Korea absolutely love it and it will definitely be one of the restaurants we throw into the routine. Plus - my mom loves that they give patbingsu as your dessert (they keep it simple with condensed milk and red bean - super yummy). Definitely give this place a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork jowl
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket

939_U0437btbTOuOIOSKmw.text: This was our first stop after we landed in Las Vegas. We were hungry but not too hungry to throw down too much food. So we decided to come here.   I ordered the beef rib soup. The rest of the family ordered the cold buckwheat noodles, bimibap, a tofu soup. The food came out pretty quick, the banchan was good and fresh, and the service was pretty good.  A good stop to fill up for Korean family.   cc accepted. Bathroom was clean but the urinal was out of order.

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs stew/soup
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan

cxdti-LV0TIPYGmhACjeNw.text: My first time trying Korean BBQ was a success! Let me start off by saying the only reason they are getting 4 stars, and not 5 is due to the service! The food was perfect!  Not too hard to find in china town,  with a huge parking lot! I took my 10 month daughter, no issues Magal was very kid friendly. I kept her in her stroller most of the time, due to the grill. As far as the decor it's very modern, spacious, and as far as I can tell clean!   The service could  have  been better, maybe they were short staffed. Upon walking in no one greeted us, and it was pretty warm inside. It for sure wouldn't hurt to lower the AC a bit being that it's 110 degrees outside. Finally I was able to flag  someone down to seat us . Our booth was cozy and private. Once again we were seated without menus and after waiting a bit I had to flag a server down. After that it was pretty smooth.   We went with the beef Combo for two, which was a little over 60$, totally worth it, the amount of food is well over that! The side dishes were very good. My favorites were the scallion salad, the kimchi which in the past I've never liked. There's happened to be very fresh, which made it taste amazing. I also really enjoyed the soup, fresh veggies some tofu and beef. Just the correct level of spice. We also got some rice and another salad.  The dipping sauce for the beef was very good as well too, sweet but tangy.  They waitress made sure she came back around to explain the process, flip our beef, and change the grills. Certain meats require different grille tops.   Lastly we got a shaved ice desert, I didn't get a chance  to taste, because I was so stuffed, but my niece loved it! So much food, well worth the calories might I add. The flavor was all on point.   If your looking for great Korean bbq in town, this is the place to go. Thanks to my girlfriend for taking me!

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad with a pineapple sweet dressing.
Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious ribs cooking! So good !

BKeWgH24JhwUJwc7eVk_4A.text: This place was the bomb!  We stumbled onto this place looking for something to eat before HH at the Tiki Bar across the street on Thanksgiving day.  It is small, but it was very clean and the hostess seated us right away.  We were the only non Asians in the place when we arrived. A good sign in my opinion when eating at an Asian restaurant.    The server came over and asked if we were familiar with Korean BBQ.  We assured her we knew what we were doing.  The menu was really large.  With so many choices, we could not decide on what to get, so we ordered on of the combo dinners for 2.  Our table was immediately filled with sauces and sides and the grill turned on.  After a few minutes the meat came out and our server put some on the grill for us.  Our table was completely full of plates to try!! Our server did do most of the cooking, but we did not mind.  We were so busy eating we might have burned the meats if she had not kept watch for us. The service was great and the food was fantastic. There was not a dish we did not like.  We even had two boxes of leftovers to take with us.  Best Korean BBQ we have had in the States.  It was better than one we went to in Bangkok as well.   Definitely coming back here next time we go to Chinatown in Vegas!

tbtO-0a0_dBWEgggVXyWYw.text: Great Korean BBQ.    Great spread of sides/sauces.   The meat was tender and tasty.   The wait staff helped cook and make sure we didn't over cook it.     Good selection of beer and Soju.  Great shaved ice dessert.  Thanks for a great meal

fJX2Nzhul6sd0QWT7zNzJg.text: This is the second time I've been here, and it's been excellent both times. I like the traditional feel of the restaurant. Our server, I believe her name was Sunny P based on our receipt, was fantastic. She was knowledgeable and understood what we wanted to order. I went to Hobak the last time I was in Vegas, and the server didn't know anything about the menu or the answers to our questions. We enjoyed the marinated galbi, spicy pork skirtmeat and soybean stew. Their complimentary heotkkae berry tea is delicious. Also they don't play their music crazy loud or anything. I didn't realize this was something that bothered me until I went to an AYCE that played super loud techno music.   Can't wait to come back. I will definitely bring my parents here.

woMyWZsfdnjWEL-yqab7_A.text: Awesome authentic Korean food with attentive seLunch special: Tofu Soup & Chicken $14.95  The chicken hot plate was kinda bland but nothing some kim chi won't fix! I loved the hot Heotkkae berry tea. Been told it's an herbal tea great for hangovers and digestive issues.  12/6- Came for dinner. The young wait staff was horrible. I was the only customer and I received zero service and one of the young men made a smart ass remark when I left. There a zillion different Korean and/or Asian restaurants in Korean/Chinatown that I don't have to tolerate lil punk turds and nonexistent service.

S0TWtR-pvS3AWgv0QULZZQ.text: It's so hard to find a good Kbbq spot in vegas that compares to the ones in Cali. Magal is definitely my favorite. I love their banchan. I especially love how the veggies in the fermented bean soup is cooked perfectly, not mushy and over cooked. I would give 5 stars, but the servers are quite lazy.

A62eX-ZVWebv9CBMe_yZwA.text: We went here for my husband's birthday for lunch. It was our first time and we had a great experience! Everything was so good from the appetizers to all the meat! Thank you, Magal :)

vm2cETXq-rX_sq2XIs0ZKg.text: Excellent food and with exceptional service from Jennifer. Quality is great and and flavourful. Would recommend to anyone looking for quality kbbq in town.

8Zhx56N48uIL7o0M-6ZtgA.text: Delicious food and big servings but somewhat pricey for lunch. Just wish they had smaller portions and lower prices for lunch. It was my first time to a Korean Barbeque so I wasn't prepared to grill our food at the table. We didn't want to cook our food and smell like smoke, so the waitress did it for us on the next empty table.  The lunch waitress was very accommodating but I noticed while she was helping the table near us she was leaning over and talking over another customers food for a good amount of time. Call me a 'germaphobic' but I prefer not to have someone else talk or breathe over my food. Aside from that I would recommend the place for dinner with family or friends.

GAMr7EqIRGuPStW-jo08yg.text: I came here for the first time on my birthday 06/25/2017 and I was just doing some yelping for local restaurants near me. Very thankful I was able to come across this place right around the corner from where I live. I was super drawn in by the pictures of corn cheese that other reviewers left, I just had to have it. When we arrived we were seated right away and everything else after that was a taste bud extravaganza. For one the cheese corn was good and I couldn't wait to eat it. However, that was probably the only thing we were served that was not completely demolished. The meat and complimentary sides are delicious alone the cheese overpowered the taste of the meats but was just right with the grilled mushrooms. All of the different flavors to go with the delicious tender meat is indescribable. Normally when I eat out I can call every taste in the food and go home and make it, but this place introduced my taste buds to a whole new world flavor. I can't wait to go back, I wanted to make this a weekly spot but I don't want to burn it out so me and some friends will be here once a month for sure.

nHy3KAt3NOpKPKMFP8LddA.text: As of July 2016, another new Korean BBQ chain restaurant from Korea (this one is 400+ restaurants in Korea) now open for business in Las Vegas. This is always a good sign, since they are usually professional managed, delicious and current. We ordered the combo for 2, $60 and there was tons of food. Great cuts of short rib, brisket and kalbi. Soups, sides or banchan all come out and were very well seasoned.

nw-_8-Kij0dRSXf-_I0jPA.text: First time trying this place and the environment is lively and the servers are entertaining. We got the large beef combo and it did not disappoint. I've never seen the egg part of the roasting pan so that was a nice addition. Overall I'm really happy with the service and ambience.

uY_T8KZGZ8aWdE6jpl9PXQ.text: This is the first Korean BBQ I have had and I absolutely love it! They had a great variation of meats and sides to chose from. The customer service was A+ and the environment had great good vibes. If you come ask for young to serve you he's super nice and energetic. Cheers!

6EwhuCe1QPTGK_jesponmw.text: This Korean BBQ is probably one of the best one in Vegas because of their high meat quality and excellent services.  I would recommend to anyone who is a fan of Korean BBQ. And Our server is Troy, he can multitask!!

u_y_sm4XI22W77Hi6goCTQ.text: The service was on point. Jessie one of the waitress was very kind and thoughtful to the point where I felt like she was part of the family.  The Egg and the corn was delicious also.

oyZ9ZOqJ9jfpgnelEJPVwg.text: Great service and good quality meat used. Ordered the beef combination (meant for two people) split between three people and we could not finish it! The meal was great!

EZpz3c9Tc0BHEw_RzxXRSw.text: A friend recommended this place.  The short ribs and marinated short ribs are tasty.  But you have to order the volcano rice...it's their version of kimchi fried rice which they cook at the table...it hits the spot.  Ill definitely be back here on my next trip to vegas.

TVvzYW2xjPtZcjj6jIs29g.text: So this is our new go to BBQ place now, great food, great service, just overall always been a great experience. FYI the for two beef combo is way more than enough for two people. ^.^

8ZNM5Y6eRLz1DNGAV6fD5w.text: Great service and yummy Korean BBQ. What more could you ask for? Ask for Troy and David as your servers!

OLR979M5iJU2woX3MJmjzA.text: Holy shit. So much food, everything was incredible. Except for the prawn head, which I was advised not to eat by "Kate"... but she ate one, so I had to eat one.  We got the beef dinner for 3-4. We could have probably fed every homeless person on the strip and still had some for take away. First time Korean BBQer and I'm a raving fan now.  Great customer experience and delicious food.

bX1DbvmEui3yt9ba58Z0yQ.text: Great service and food! We ordered the large beef combination, it's a must try! Service was above and beyond, very quick at getting a table and the servers were great at making sure that our food was cooked exactly the way we wanted. They were very fast at making sure that our side dishes were filled and our water was filled! I would recommend this place to anyone that wants to try various great fresh meats! And my favorite was the beef that was torched right in front of you! It made the whole experience even better!

photos.caption: Photo of Magal BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super cute shrimp

Hi_uS4o9QQXlnJB3k4Xp1w.text: Fantastic place. Excellent food. Bring your friends, family, business colleagues...whomever. Fantastic place!

cChH876zrkmmuf9g-lbysA.text: Adding to the list of local spots we explore, this BBQ place is great!  We got the Beef Plate and it was amazing. Full range of meats and it's all cooked right in front of u.  When you first get there you are escorted to your table which has a burner right in the middle and food is already placed and ready for your enjoying.  The only thing you will need to order is your drinks, side dish, choice of meat platter, and deserts if desired.  The only downfall that we experienced was the lack of direction on our first visit.  Unless you go to Korean bbq places a lot, you may not know what half the foods are in front of you.  And the service was a bit slow.  Otherwise...the food was great and such a cool experience!  This place should b a must stop and it's only a few mins from the strip.

41OqB3lzm9_wJiM0SCQECw.text: Great Korean BBQ experience. Though keep in mind you're paying for it. Recommended for large groups.  Young was great. Cooked stuff perfectly.

PJGcRrS5GKg0_-6zu9RqBg.text: From la to Vegas!!! Had to try my favorite kbbq joint in Vegas!! The space is a lot bigger than the one in la but the taste is just the same~~ our server David was wonderful!! Serving 10 of us was crazy work but he made all of us happy!! Good music, great food, and our server David made our Vegas Magal experience legendary~~lol will visit again!!

prv9KUmno7jdSTrxalM5MA.text: This place is really delicious!, good prices, and customer service is really nice. I would definitely come her again, and thanks to Mickie that works here, she was very helpful

E4R88FAKDa1QNsrzo9rjPg.text: The waiter Jennifer was rude. She wouldn't let us cook our meat and if we would touch the meat she would tell us to hand it over. We wanted our meat cooked a bit more but she said that it was fine like that. The meat made my stomach feel bloated. Anways the food was alright but Not sure if I would come back. Most likely not.

7o_GH7-TQjoiCopu1sq4oQ.text: Good food, good service and comfortable. Prices are much better than other Korean restaurants in the area, too.

tXrgsHvgiX25RZaq11j-jA.text: The food was pretty good, but not good enough for the wait. Our waiter Troy was amazing and the kimchi was as well but everything else was forgettable

bpvUGhffuHFt0ozT2KNsOA.text: I went in with a little apprehension based on my experience at other Korean BBQ's I have visited.  We were greeted with a smiling face upon entering.  The wait staff was excellent.  Patient and knowledgeable.  The house tea is an iced tea and it was delicious.  We ordered the beef combo.  We were immediately set up with a multitude of delicious side dishes including an awesome kimchi and pickled celery that was addictive.  The soup was rich with flavor and was hard to put down.  The beef showed up and our server prepared the meat on the grill for us as we ate.  The quality of the meat really showed through and we finished off all of the tender flavorful beef in short order.  The meal was capped by 2 head on shrimp cooked to perfection.  I will definitely add this restaurant to my list of favorite places.  Grill on!

q7AgfCM3aZaTeiQljKdwUA.text: One of the best Korean restaurants I've tried. Good service and good food. Must try especially the Pork Jowl.

yGPqi0iwS7sftZgXxLk_ag.text: My family enjoyed the food and service. The beef combo was great and our server Sunny was the best!

6m7ikrUYWOAsoFCM8GM4lw.text: The best Korean BBQ I have everrrrr had!!!! Can't beat quality and amazing service! Thank you Alex for your hospitality and service!

QjqEeApzbgaNKrWg08nSXw.text: Excellent spot for group dinners. Get some beer and soju to accompany your meal, and go hungry!

hq3Hzv1Ox951o4xuwGfESQ.text: Excellent food, great service and good company. I would recommend Pork Skirt with cheese fondue. Magal I is one of the best food in town!

mPtn4oQgWB4s0CF5q0g0Wg.text: Great place for eating lots of yummy food. Definitely top 5 in las vegas. Has the better appetizers than most kbqq places.

ZhJFLW1DDQTkiciE6gAvqQ.text: Honestly so disappointed. Magal use to be my favorite KBBQ place and now it has lost its luster. I understand when it's busy things get lost in the shuffle. We ordered the beef combo and we were missing items from our order. We asked for the items and still did not receive them even towards the end of our meal. We were left to fend for ourselves which was fine, but we weren't given tools to do so. I can't really cook using just my fingers. Overall it was just a super awful experience. Maybe they were just having a bad day but all the other times I've gone there everything was amazing so idk.

3vPczLLhZHaw6OpMDnmgCw.text: Authentic hip/oldish Korean style tabletop BBQ you can get in LV! Love the list of entrees offered and great customer service. Will be there again for sure.

DtSL1V9BAc9WVMJ1ARwaKg.text: Magal vs. Hobak! Fight! Both are amazing. I may like Magal just a bit more at this point. Ask again in 6 months, after I've been back a dozen times each.

s8ZKEZUDB0r_YvyVZ2nd0w.text: After eating at the Magal BBQ in LA I knew I had to try this one in Vegas! Just recently opened, it was already pretty packed in the place. One of the unique things about this restaurant is their greetings and how they personally cook your meat. Right before we were seated we had to wait a little but when they took us to our table all the side dishes and grill was ready for us which was awesome! Everybody was attentive and the meat was so delicious that it's truly incomparable to the other KBBQ places in Vegas. Can't wait to come again and eat at my favorite place for gogi and cold noodles!

iGFVd4mETkGOAvVYMbJnkQ.text: Magal BBQ was great after a long weekend of drinking! The environment was great and the service was awesome! Our propane tank was not working so the owner had to move our table.  He also gave us extra meat for having to move us.  The price was just right!  Definitely suggesting this place to friends and who ever loves Korean BBQ!

_j20lAg7zJSvC1KjWgVGYg.text: I haven't leave this restaurant yet but I already can't wait to put down comments here. It's such a great place to have Kroean BBQ in Vegas! I feel this place is even better than Kang Hodong BBQ in LA. Wonderful experience with my family dine in here! My dad wan't very interest in Kroean food, but this meal has totally changed his mind. I'm so glad to see how good their service is. Nice people nice service, very caring. Appreciate it! Lovely meal! Hope everyone have an awesome meal in here as I do! =P

NNPHtU4Au_bw6hDAo3-gcQ.text: This place can get pricey, but it's worth it!! The marinated kalbi with the big bone attached to it is to die forrrrr.. So juicy and tender. Most pieces just melt in your mouth. Pork jowl is pretty good too but I prefer Hobak's pork jowl over this place. Meat quality is definitely top notch. You get what you pay for. And the nengmyeon...... Dude, this is the place to go for it. I've tried other places in Vegas and thought nothing could compare to nengmyeon in LA but this place hits the spot. During lunch they have a special which is 8.99 for a full size bowl of nengmyeon and you can choose either mul nengmyeon or the spicy one and it comes with a side of cooked bulgogi. The full size a la carte of nengmyeon is 9.99 so for a dollar less plus a side of bulgogi.. I'm sold! Keep in mind that lunch is only mon-fri and ends at 3p. Back to the BBQ.. There aren't that many side dishes at all but they have the grill with the egg and this place doesn't do corn cheese but corn with mayo, not my fav, I prefer corn cheese. There's kimchi, salad, spicy bean sprout salad mix, and pajeon for the banchan. If you want just good BBQ, I'd probably go to Hobak but if you want good everything I'd come here. They give you a free appetizer that's similar to gazpacho and free bite size cheesecake at the end too!
